answers.answer: Unfortunately, children have a 'sweet tooth' like adults. Some worst then others. If she is asking for sugar then give her natural sources: fresh fruit, frozen fruit (unsweetened) or canned fruit in natural juice. Try to limit juices because they are high in added sugar. Fruit has natural sugar, however, she benefits from the vitamins and minerals, and fiber in the fruit.

question: Every time I turn around lately my 6 year old daughter HAS to have sugar.  My older daughter never HAD to have sugar, of course every child likes to have a treat.  But my 6 year old acts as though she NEEDS it.  She asks for candy, gum, apples, juice, popsicles, anything with sugar in it.  Her father has diabetes, and it runs in my family (my mother has it also).  Should I have her tested for low blood sugar?Thanks!!
title: 6 Year Old Craves Sugar
